title: Centos 7.6.1810 + firefox.x86_64 0:60.9.0-1.el7.centos => GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: ...: g_object_ref: assertion 'object->ref_count > 0' failed
content:
Hello !

I have a physical machine with Centos 7.6.1810 and Firefox 60.9.0-1.el7.centos installed.

I start a Xvfb, and try to start firefox, and get this output: Running without a11y support! 

 (firefox:7740): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: 23:18:17.497: g_object_ref: assertion 'object->ref_count > 0' failed  Segmentation fault

I tried to install a virtual machine with same OS, over VirtualBox in a Win10. Same OS, same firefox rpm. I start a Xvfb and try to start firefox, and works fine.

So my physical machine has something that makes Firefox to crash and do not start.

Can someone help me ?
creator: fcojavier_sa

title: Single click acts like double click on tab? Mac 10.15.4, FF 76.0.1 (super annoying on 4K screen)
content:
if I am selecting tabs rapidly, say select tab number 5, then quickly move to tab 7 and single click to show it. Suddenly FF enlarges to fill the screen as if I selected the tab and double clicked it. This does NOT occur if I do it slowly. I often do this to move two tabs closer together so I can keystroke between them for comparison (changing tabs using the keystroke does not cause the problem)

I have been very careful to ensure a single click occurs, and I can replicate it to happen every time. If I move SLOWLY, and click say after a second, it behaves as I would expect and simply selects the tab.

Since I have a 4K screen, FF is usually in the middle taking up about 1/3 of the area and is very usable. When the screen is blown out to the edges, text is hard to read as lines are so long, and I can't see other apps I have up for reference without resizing the window.

BTW, the double click does not do a mac ZOOM, enlarging the window to be 'full screen' as happens when clicking the green dot. Instead if behaves exactly as it does when double clicking on a tab, enlarging the window to go edge to edge and under the main menu to the bottom of the screen.

I tried doing a safe mode restart, and the same problem occurs when no extensions are loaded.

Is this a setting or preference somewhere, and can anyone else see this happening? I only have 1 mac to test on. Mac OSX 10.15.4, FF 76.0.1
creator: andywestaz

title: DNS over HTTPS results in Little Snitch prompting for permissions for unknown numeric IPs — how can a user make judgments about whether to connect?
content:
I use Little Snitch as a firewall. It prompts for a yes/no on each connection that is about to be made. The only way I know of to make an informed decision in each case is to see the servers requesting a connection, of which there are many for each page request. When using DoH, these become numeric IP addresses, about which I know nothing, other than looking them up with Terminal nslookup, the first several of which turned out to be:

23.193.33.57 a23-193-33-57.deploy.static.akamaitechnologies.com. 172.217.7.4 lga25s56-in-f4.1e100.net. 4.7.217.172.in-addr.arpa namelga25s56-in-f4.1e100.net. 52.216.205.35 s3-1-w.amazonaws.com. 13.225.222.73 server-13-225-222-73.jfk51.r.cloudfront.net. 142.250.64.99 lga34s31-in-f3.1e100.net.

None of these was directly related to what I was trying to do, though cloudfront and akamai are frequent flyers. So I don't know if these were encrypted-DNS servers (though only cloudfront is supposed to be a default) or participant in the page I was attempting to reach.

This is clearly not a practical way to use a browser. It would appear that I will have to have DoH turned off in order to use the firewall. Is anyone else having this issue? Is there any other solution other than turning DoH off?

Thanks for any help.
creator: datlee

title: Stop message telling me to update firefox to a new version
content:
I have seen similar requests but they all seem to go down some dirt road and leave the topic.

First the issue I am having is with Firefox v72 on the Windows 10 computer provided by work. This company has thousands of employees and the IT department is not responsive.

My issue: Every time I launch Firefox a pop-up window appears telling me that Firefox can't update to the latest version. This message reappears periodically throughout the day. I would like to prevent this or at least have it occur 1 time a week or month. I have tried adjusting the advanced settings but nothing seems to fix this issue and frankly I do not even see a change in the duration of the message.

Now before the folks concerned about security "recommend" that I should update to the latest version because it is the safest and best version, please understand that I do know. A large office with many users, OSes, computers, apps in use apparently does not have the flexibility needed to keep the Firefox browser happy. I certainly can't force the IT department to update Firefox (I have asked).

I'd love for Mozilla to give us control of this feature again, but I am not counting on it. So I am hoping that someone reading this has found a solution that will work for V72 of Firefox.

Each browser has issues, this one is minor, an annoyance for me. My continuing to use this browser depends on more than this issue. When I consider Pros and Cons of this browser this goes in the Cons column.

I NEED HELP!!!!!

title: Attempting to seach for a bookmark (in Firefox Library) causes "not responding" message, altho search is completed in 8 minutes. Help?
content:
Hi...Every time I attempt to search for a bookmark by clicking "show your bookmarks" (or Ctrl/shift/b), then selecting "all bookmarks", then attempting to type something in the search box, it freezes...and just allows me to press enter, it then turns the "x" in the top right red, and gives a "Not responding" message next to Library(in the top left)..I can still click the red x to cancel the search.

I say attempting to do a search, as it only allows me to type up to 4 (is the most) letters in the search box...its often just one letter before it freezes, and the curser turns into a spinning blue circle....If i just leave it for around 8 minutes,(after pressing enter) it then lists my bookmarks with the search criteria I had used, and the "Not responding" message disappears....and the machine goes back to normal

I have tried removing all my addons and extensions, tried renaming my prefs.js file, but it still hangs and takes 8 minutes.

I havent as yet done a reinstall of Firefox without any of my personal data, or tried a refresh.

The laptop is an HP i7 16gb ram, Win 10 Pro 64bit 1909, Firefox 76.0.1...with all updates present.

title: After a windows update, firefox won't load any pages but other browsers will - no error message, just "new tab" and continual buffering
content:
My computer did an automatic WINDOWS update last night (using windows 10 on this computer for years). Today NO pages will load in firefox. All I get is a "new tab" shown in the tab itself, and a continually buffering wheel in the page. I get no error message - it just keeps buffering forever. That's whether it really is a new page, or a page with a url from a prior session - and I've tried a number of different websites with the same result.

I am using an old version of firefox 56.0.2 and do NOT want to upgrade because I have a lot of add ons that I use daily that don't have replacements in the new firefox.

Microsoft edge is loading pages just fine, so it's not a problem with my modem or router or internet service. I tried going to the network troubleshooter, and it didn't find any problems. I tried going into network settings and selected no proxy (I hope that was the right thing to do, I connect with cox internet, so I assume there's no proxy?) I made sure firefox is NOT set to "work offline"

None of this made any difference.

Please help, I count on firefox and have my sessions saved with lots of tabs I still want to read and/or use, etc.!!

title: Prevent new window from hiding addons in toolbar
content:
Recently, when a popup window appears, the toolbar doesn't have buttons for any of my addons.

In about:config, I'd intentionally set dom.disable_window_open_feature.toolbar to true (following the solution provided in: question 1206512).

Previously, this was successful in ensuring that popup windows got the full toolbar, but now it has stopped working.

I'm not sure exactly which release this started with.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Set dom.disable_window_open_feature.toolbar to true.

2) Visit https://jeffersonscher.com/res/popit.html and follow the third link.

3) The window that pops up has no toolbar icons for the installed extensions.

title: RAM exhaustion - PC crash
content:
My PC often crashes. It looks like the issue comes from RAM exhaustion.

Example extracted from system logs: Source: Resource-Exhaustion-Detector Event ID: 2004 Windows a diagnostiqué avec succès une insuffisance en mémoire virtuelle. La plus grande consommation de mémoire virtuelle s’est répartie entre les programmes suivants : firefox.exe (13952) avec 416788480 octets, firefox.exe (6456) avec 248070144 octets et firefox.exe (11376) avec 243785728 octets.

I have reduced the parameter "Nombre maximum de processus de contenu" from 8 (default) to 6 -> my PC still crashes with the same error.

I have tried deactivating modules, safe mode, uninstall, reinstall... -> quite similar

How can I check and improve firefox RAM usage?

title: When returning to the Firefox browser from another app, I land on a different window than the one I was on (Mac OS Catalina) before moving to the app.
content:
Hello there !

This is what happens: I'm using Firefox, with several windows open. I'm on this support page, for instance (image 1), and I look up my calendar, or messages, or Zoom, etc. (image 2)

In the background of this app window, Firefox immediately displays another page, one that was open but hidden, in fact the one next to the page I was on. (image 2)

And when I return to Firefox, I'm still on that window, so I have to manually return to the page I was on before I opened the othe app.

Thank your for your help!

Olivier

title: What happens when you merge multiple firefox profiles under one sync account?
content:
Before I begin, apologies in advance if this was answered many times already.

I have a situation where I have two work computers and a personal computer. For a while, I used a cloud storage solution to sync a single profile folder across my devices, but something messed up at some point, so I have not been doing that for a few years. Now I have three different profile data (specifically logins and bookmarks) that overlaps on some areas, but are different in others. I would like to merge them all without losing any data, but I don't want to just blindly create a mess.

So what happens when I log into same Firefox account across these devices? What would happen if I have different logins stored for the same page? or if some of the bookmarks are organized differently?
creator: battleangel

title: Firefox changes theme after every restart
content: I am currently running Firefox 76.0.1 on Ubuntu 18.04 after a fresh install. I logged into my FF account and everything synced, bookmarks, add-ons, etc. But every time I restart the browser, even after a couple of seconds, my Matte Black theme changes to a theme that I have NEVER applied, made, nor even seen in the theme catalog, even on my previous Ubuntu installation. I tried running FF in Safe Mode and "Refreshed Firefox" but the problem occurs after a minute or two after starting the browser afterwards and the theme changes again. I deleted the profile .js file for a new file to be created, but that does not work. It's as if the Sync didn't sync the new changes made to the browser.

title: Random positions for new windows - those are even visually broken
content:
Good day everyone. A couple months ago my Firefox started to behave a little weird on opening new windows. At work I have to use our Ticket-System. When there is a Ticket I have to open it by double clicking. The window will open in a new window. This window always gets a weird position on my second screen and it looks like it would be zoomed, but it isn't. Here a Screenshot (left = MacBook, right = external 4K Monitor). I have a the same behavior when working in our CMS.

What I did for troubleshooting:

  1. Command + 0 to make sure it's really not zoomed (btw. if it would be zoomed there would be a % mark right to the URL).
  2. Close all windows and restart Firefox

Based on https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1172141

  1. I deleted xulstore.json
  2. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/refresh-firefox-reset-add-ons-and-settings
  3. finally I create a new clean profile and completely deleted the old one

None of the above changed the behavior. I have no clue what to do. Any ideas/help is appreciated. I can't stick to Firefox otherwise for now, it really stresses me out since I'm usually having lot of TABS+Windows opened.

Need any more information? Let me know.

macOS Catalina 10.15.3 MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2017) Firefox 76.0.1 (64-Bit)
creator: mike.wenzel

title: Synchronisation der  neuen Tab-Umgebungen (Firefox Multi-Account Container) nicht möglich - unterschiedliche Sichheitseinstellungen ?
content:
1. Ich möchte auf allen Geräten die gleiche Tab-Umgebung (Firefox Multi-Account Container) haben, da ich die vorgegebenen Tabs des Multi Account Containers umbenannt und die Anzahl erweitert habe. Eine Möglichkeit zur Synchronisation hierzu finde ich in den Einstellungen jedoch nicht.

2. Ich möchte für die Tabs unterschiedlich strenge Sicherheitseinstellungen anlegen. Ich sehe jedoch keine Möglichkeit hierzu, außer, dass ich das Programm Firefox für jede Tab-Umgebung separat öffne und dann die Sicherheitseinstellungen abändere. Ich habe dann das Programm Firefox vielleicht 5 oder 6 x am Bildschirm geöffnet.

Google Translation:

1.I want to have the same tab environment (Firefox Multi-Account Container) on all devices, because I renamed the given tabs of the Multi Account Container and expanded the number. However, I do not find a way to synchronize this in the settings.

2. I want to create different security settings for the tabs. However, I see no way of doing this, except that I open the Firefox program for each tab environment separately and then change the security settings. I then opened the Firefox program maybe 5 or 6 times on the screen.
creator: hedwig-f-bieber-oth
